body: I don't like how `getTablesUsedInFrom()` processes `yii\db\Expression` now. By definition `yii\db\Expression` must be treated as a black box, not analyzed or processed in any way and inserted into generated SQL as is. I think `getTablesUsedInFrom()` should just throw exception (`throw new InvalidConfigException(gettype($this->from) . ' in $from is not supported.');`) when `$this->from` is a `\yii\db\Expression`. This won't break any existing code btw, because so far neither `\yii\db\Query` nor `getTablesUsedInFrom()` worked correctly at all when `from` was `yii\db\Expression`.
Table names aren't used in the code generation at all. Aliases only.

> Table names aren't used in the code generation at all. Aliases only.

Currently `getTablesUsedInFrom()` analyzes the string from `yii\db\Expression` to extract the subquery alias. No framework code should ever try to look into the string of `yii\db\Expression` to try to understand it or extract its subparts, etc. The only thing the framework can do with `yii\db\Expression` must be inserting its string unmodified into generated query or to pass the whole `yii\db\Expression` object as is as parameter or return value to some other function.
OK. That makes sense. @SilverFire would you please handle it? Too busy today and I'm afraid it will be lost.
